intro: Thlaspi tymphaeum, commonly known as the alpine cabbages, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in alpine and arctic regions. The plant has small, rounded leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations. Thlaspi tymphaeum is adapted to cold climates and has mechanisms to survive harsh winter conditions.
